title: Self-Regulated Learning (SRL) Strategy Training Program for Biology Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental biology concepts and job-based language proficiency
context.additional_context: Aims to improve biology learning outcomes through self-regulated learning training with digital devices. Emphasizes workplace relevance for working professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the three core elements of self-regulated learning (SRL): behavioral/environmental regulation, cognitive strategies, and metacognition.
Learners can establish and execute personalized learning plans using digital tools when studying biology.
Learners can identify issues arising during the self-regulated learning process through formative assessments and propose improvement measures.
Learners achieve an 80% or higher correct answer rate for items requiring conceptual understanding (e.g., process explanation, principle application) in biology exams.

resources: Tablet PC or laptop (1 device per person)
Digital Self-Regulated Learning Training Platform Account

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
